content: AMA SG Young Investment Investments General Asked by AnonymousAsked on 07 Sep 2018What is in your portfolio now? And how will it change in the next 5 years?If you could share in detail if you are more of a dividend investor or value investor and why you take the chosen approach.1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Soh Sing Heng, Financial Blogger at SG Young InvestmentLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 09 Sep 2018My portfolio mainly includes dividend stocks like REITs that gives about 5-8% dividends and blue chips companies that pays sustainable good dividends of about 5%. About 70% is made up of dividend stocks and the rest will be value stocks. To be a value investor, more time is needed for research to spot value companies which will grow over the long term. I prefer to structure my portfolio heavier on dividend stocks as it doesn't require a lot of time to manage. I focus more time on growing my savings through higher income. I do not think this will change over the next 5 years. 0 comments1
